intro: Clypeola jonthlaspi proles gaudinii, commonly known as the slender clypeola, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, elongated leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in meadows or along stream banks. It has a compact growth habit and is known for its delicate appearance. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare species in many regions.
